earth.name: Earth
earth.headline: Our luminous blue home world
earth.description: Earth is the only known world with a stable hydrosphere and thriving biosphere. Its magnetosphere and layered atmosphere shield a dynamic surface shaped by plate tectonics and weather.
highlights: Global navigation satellites weave an invisible infrastructure
Auroral curtains reveal space weather in real-time

moon.name: Moon
moon.headline: Tidal storyteller and archive of impacts
moon.description: The Moon preserves eons of Solar System history across cratered highlands and basaltic maria. Its slow rotation and tenuous exosphere create stark day-night contrasts.
highlights: Regolith stores solar wind particles for in-situ study
Libration reveals hidden crater rims each lunar night
South pole peaks offer near-permanent sunlight

mars.name: Mars
mars.headline: Rust-hued frontier of robotic explorers
mars.description: Mars hosts canyons, volcanoes, and ancient river deltas that chronicle a wetter past. Thin atmosphere and dust-driven seasons sculpt its present climate.
highlights: Perseverance rover caches samples for the first Mars return
Recurring slope lineae hint at seasonal brines
Subsurface ice maps reveal future landing depots
